metadata.title: CVE-2019-13075 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - negligible
metadata.description:
Tor Browser through 8.5.3 has an information exposure vulnerability. Itallows remote attackers to detect the browser's language via vectorsinvolving an IFRAME element, because text in that language is included inthe title attribute of a LINK element for a non-HTML page. This is relatedto a behavior of Firefox before 68.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-13075` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 73.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 73.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 73.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '73.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
